title: 2 Easy Ways to Find Out the Last Time Your Computer Was Used

steps.title: Right-click the Start menu.
steps.content: Right-click the Start menu. This will open a menu. [1] X Research source This method will work on Windows 10 and Windows 11 computers.

steps.title: Click Event Viewer.
steps.content: Click Event Viewer . You can find this towards the top of the menu. [2] X Research source A new window will open.

steps.title: Double-click "Windows Logs".
steps.content: Double-click "Windows Logs". This is in the left panel. The folder will expand.

steps.title: Click System.
steps.content: Click System . This will be underneath Setup' .

steps.title: View the event log.
steps.content: View the event log. You'll see a list of everything that happened on your computer with the date, time, source, event ID, and more. [3] X Research source Click an event to see more details.

steps.title: Find when your computer was turned on (optional).
steps.content: Find when your computer was turned on (optional). If you want to filter the event log to only show when your computer was powered on, do the following: Click Filter Current Log… in the right panel. Click the Event sources: drop-down menu. Select Power-Troubleshooter . Click OK . View the date and time for each event.

steps.title: Open Terminal
steps.content: Open Terminal . This can be done from the Launchpad, Finder, or Spotlight. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Type last and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Type last and press ↵ Enter . This will send the command.

steps.title: View the event log.
steps.content: View the event log. Terminal will list all recent login events with your account username and the date and time it happened. [5] X Research source If you suspect someone is using your computer without your knowledge, changing your password may help.
